LMBiw02E0bDpeBESwOHIKw.text: My aunt lives in Singapore and recommended that I should try mos burger because it's only available in Asia.I ordered a spicy mos burger and my initial thought when I got it was that it was very sloppy like a sloppy joe, but when I bit into it I was surprised that it was actually pretty good!If you want to try this place I would advise you to avoid eating here at peak hours because it tends to get busy and you'll probably won't be able to find a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Mos Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

ncPlibMX70mExa21JOnsnA.text: The Case of the Confused Fast Food. Now... I don't normally write reviews about fast food joints. Not because they're not good or creative but well.... It's because they're fast food outlets. They should taste the same everywhere? Right?I couldn't help but write this because of the "rebranding", if you could call it that, that MOS burger is trying to do. It's not uncommon either. In recent years, we've seen McDonald's launch McCafe, KFC having KFC cafe, so it comes as little surprise that another fast food outlets decides to join the fray. MOS café, newly rebranded, offering desserts and some new innovative burgers like the Wagyu Tower or the Osaka yaki rice burger, the Tortilla salad, vegetable smoothies, all items not found at other MOS outlets. They even had mock displays of their food at the entrance, all nicely presented on plates and looking pretty good. Even a look at their website is impressive, "MOS Café was conceptualised as a FLAGSHIP CAFE that caters to the LIFESTYLE of our consumers....... Driven by a "FRESH" CONCEPT - using lots of fresh vegetables and fruits. The menu is made up of ORIGINAL Café items as well as items CAREFULLY CURATED from the MOS burger menu". Sounds exciting. However, upon reaching the entrance of the restaurant, with exception to the huge "MOS Café" sign, nothing much has changed. It still looks like a MOS burger, the seats still look the same, no cozy sofa corners and still filled with booth seats. The ordering counter looked the same and even the uniform was the same (at least McCafe took the effort to give the barista's a different outfit).  But well.... We decided to give it a shot. Once ordering, it was clearly confirmed to me that... It was nothing but a sad rebranding attempt and an even desperately gimmicky attempt to make themselves look and sound updated.Firstly, I get the same number tag I get at MOS burger. Fair enough. Than came my cups in a regular mos burger paper cup. No change there. But when our orders came, the all too familiar basket appeared. In it were our burgers and fries. What happened to all the nicely played burgers you were promoting by the window? Why was everything still wrapped? I don't deny it.. I felt cheated. Anyway... On to the food. I won't spend too much time on the regular items as I'm sure we're pretty familiar with those. Osaka Yaki burger. Now this looked good... In picture and on display. Of course I'm not expecting it to look the same when served, especially not since its in a wrapper. Taste wise.... Decent. However, I am left with figuring out what I actually ate. While the image showed a nice layer of egg, fried seafood patty topped with bonito flakes, I could only make the egg out in the burger itself. I'm still trying to figure out the protein they gave. Was it fish? Prawns? No clue. Unfortunately, the project they embarked on fell pretty much on its face.Don't get me wrong, I love MOS burger, but, in terms of this being a flagship concept and a cafe? It's more a MOS burger doing cosplay on a budget than it is actually being a MOS Cafe.

photos.caption: Photo of Mos Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Mos Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Mos Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

fAIYuUX6p47_-xJO3bmEBQ.text: Had to stop eating because the texture and flavor was odd.  I'm not a fan of the Golden Arches, but I'd rather have had a chemical burger from the Golden Arches than eat the burger as MOS.  Memo to self - wait to get home to the U.S. to eat a burger.  On a brighter note, customer service was great and french fries were fine.

photos.caption: Photo of Mos Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Menu
Photo of Mos Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. 5 piece nugget.
Photo of Mos Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Inside of burger.  Texture was funny.

rUXOOpXTV67YMOfmiY68dQ.text: I was going for 5 stars but you "DO NOT SERVE DIET/LIGHT COKE"?!? W.T.H.I loved you man. Loved you since I was a teen. Back in the days when Britney released her first hit single. I longed for your rice burgers when I moved to Australia and then Canada/America. Now I'm back here I wanted to rekindle our love. But when you told me you didn't have diet/light Coke, you spat right into my mouth. And to top it off, you did not allow me to pay using my credit card. Not. Cool. Bra. Not. Cool.From 5 to 3 and now 1. Why? Well as I went over to trash my wrappers and return the tray I saw you emptying the tea from the dispenser - it was closing time and you were draining different teas into one bucket. So I asked, even though I know it's not typically refillable, "hey mind pouring me some? I did buy a whole last cup of unsweetened ice tea". "No refilling". "But you're pouring them away right?". No answer and you just looked away.Service. Matters. Douche.

photos.caption: Photo of Mos Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

l6mgPfw6ZN-PAdtEJ5swlQ.text: This is a delightful place to have brunch.I would like to thank the staff for keeping and returning my sister's handphone. They made sure that they were returning to the rightful owner. This shows how thoughtful they manage the cafe. Good job keep it up!

g8lDM_Zslrf_IXE1Tyr6Dg.text: Matcha Latte - a new drink from Mos Burger.The color looks too tempting not to try. Well, it is good for a fast food standard. I like the light matcha taste and aroma. I did not add sugar so it is just right for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Mos Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Matcha Latte

afg9tfOOzVVDSdMYQOfciQ.text: A better choice among fast food chains? Come to Mos Burger. It is a Japanese fast food chain and there are a few in Singapore. The first chains I tried was at west mall and isetan Scotts but those stores closed down. I was browsing on what's to eat at raffles city and I was delighted to find mos burger here.Personally I am into ebi rice burger but that changed after I had allergy breakouts after eating shellfish. So looking at what's on their advertisements, I spotted salmon rice burger. All I can say is you keep wanting for more if you eat it. The salmon was cooked perfectly with the sauce on top and covered with rice buns. Yum...Service is extremely fast at this chain even though the workers are mostly elderly. You can get your order within 2-3 minutes if you do take away. Depending on what time you stop by, you might be able to find seats. I tried two chains : one near to clementi mall and the other in Ang mo kio and I still love this chain. This is the healthier choice of burgers if you consistently think about calories. YAY to Mos Burger!!

Z5coohEJ2fs2KrUUIrRVaQ.text: WORST MOS BURGER I've ever had.I got the pork with rice buns and the rice was overcooked and really dried up and hard to chew. The hokkaido ice cream was unflavourful. The only thing that's worth coming for is their corn soup made from powder. Highly disappointed with this location in Singapore. The one i had in Taiwan was way better.

photos.caption: Photo of Mos Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. rice burger - over cooked (that's not sauce at the bottom but burnt colour)
Photo of Mos Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. hokkaido ice cream and corn soup

a-ZoxOGhsFjCBiasG51DjA.text: Well this was disappointing. I wanted to try a cheap, uniquely Asian burger, and what I got was a cheap, uniquely bad burger. Bland patty, and the sauce was like a poorly made mild chili. Also, I understand that this is a fast food establishment, but that doesn't mean yelling at your customer when they ask if credit cards are accepted is warranted.

photos.caption: Photo of Mos Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Mos cheeseburger

Xkces_mrwLTCtBlpDp0RcQ.text: Interesting food selection for a fast food place. They serve soup, shrimp, and all sorts of typical fast food fare. I've tried the mos burger and plain hot dog. They are good choice if you want to try food that is different than that of KFC and McDonald's. The burgers and hot dogs taste less fatty than the other fast food chains. Would recommend to a friend.

SVXYw2e-_0wdL3IN3tq_Zg.text: I like coming here for their fries and scallops. Their burgers are nice too. Have always been a fan of Mos Burger - for their swift service, friendly disposition, great menu and options. You can get your tea less sweet, or get Barbecue sauce, etc. I love that they serve stuff in a tray and you take it out of the paper bags, etc.What I Love: Their Rice Burgers are yummmmmy. I've had the beef and chicken ones. If you want something light, then skip the Rice Burgers. They are a reasonable size - but once you have them, you'll realize that it is pretty filling. Their yummy fries and deep-fried scallops are to die for. And their nuggets. Really does beat McDonald's. And their mayo.... yum!!!What I Don't Love: Their soup. It's nothing special. And their prices! A few stuff added up together and it's like $8-$10....

photos.caption: Photo of Mos Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Mos Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

x1U6t8w524Hh0ny3uee3KA.text: Stopped in here to get something small that would get us through to dinner and weren't disappointed. I had a cheeseburger which was really delicious. There were so many flavours in the burger which is surprising for a fast food chain. The fries were also good and came with a few complimentary sauces. Service was friendly and efficient. There was a bit of a wait for food which I assume means everything is made to order: bonus!

YOgySW0hLaBKXQDKNwblDA.text: This is not my first time here but I do like going to MOS whenever I'm in Asia.  This time wasn't as good as the last time I was here or the other chains.  I had the seafood rice burger, beef rice burger and a korean beef burger.

ehwjCaIYsnO-rk0OilGHRg.text: Located at the basement of raffles cityBurger to try, Chicken Teriyaki burger and if you are watching your calorie, you can request to deskin the chicken before served. The chicken is well marinated in the teriyaki sauce.I would suggest to go with the potato croquette side dish. The plain croquette tastes much better than the curry flavoured. However the reason for visiting Mos Burger  is the milk tea. The milk tea is very rich and well balanced.As compared to other fast food store, Mos burger definitely has its own unique selling point and dishes but the price might be on the high side given the quantity served.

xhTnVd5QkLxHhoW1LIjABA.text: You can hardly go wrong with Japanese fast food! The flavors from the rice burgers here are just fantastic. The two rice burger to try for me would definitely be the beef slice rice burger and the ebi burger. If you're looking for something on the side, give the deep friend mussels a go, a great tasting alternative to the usual chicken nuggets.  For drinks, do try the milk tea, you can't go wrong with that! Meals are a little more expensive than your regular fast food joints but for the quality of food you're getting, I think it's well worth it!
